name: Spotty aloe
watering: Deeply but infrequently, allowing the top layer to dry before watering
lighting: Bright direct in the winter; bright indirect in the summer
feeding: Every 3-4 weeks, in the summer, with half-strength nitrogen based food

name: Old aloe
watering: Deeply but infrequently, allowing the top layer to dry before watering
lighting: Bright direct in the winter; bright indirect in the summer
feeding: Every 3-4 weeks, in the summer, with half-strength nitrogen based food

name: Zeezee
lighting: Almost any light level except total darkness or harsh sun
feeding: Once in spring, once in summer

name: Snek plent
watering: In summer, keep soil lightly moist; in winter, just enough so soil doesn't dry out
lighting: Bright light to full sun but will tolerate low light
feeding: Feed monthly from spring to autumn

name: Dragon tree
watering: Lightly moist spring through autumn; slightly drier in winter
lighting: Bright indirect; avoid direct sunlight in summer
feeding: Every two weeks in spring and summer

name: Spider plant
watering: Keep soil evenly moist; avoid flouride
feeding: Every two weeks through summer with half strength

name: Moth orchid
watering: Regular warm water; never cold water

name: Christmas cactus
watering: Water thoroughly but don't let it sit in water
temperature: To flower 16-18 °C day and 7-13 °C night; otherwise, 16-24 °C
feeding: Every two weeks spring through autumn

name: Mosaic plant (nerve plant)
watering: Allow soil to dry slightly between waterings
lighting: Low to medium; avoid direct sunlight
feeding: Every two to three months sprint through autumn

name: Peace lily
watering: Keep soil evenly moist but don't let it sit in water
feeding: Every month in spring and summer with half strength

name: Bird nest fern
watering: Evenly moist but don't let it sit in water
lighting: Bright indirect light; avoid direct sunlight
feeding: Every two weeks in spring and summer with half strength

name: Pink quill plant
watering: Spray with water until leaves are thoroughly wet two to three times a week; rain water or filtered tap water
lighting: Bright indirect light; avoid direct sunlight
feeding: Foliar fertiliser for wallisia once a month in spring and summer

name: Money tree (jade plant)
watering: Allow soil to dry out between waterings
lighting: Bright light with some direct sun
feeding: Monthly from spring through autumn with half strength succulent fertiliser

name: Spik
watering: Allow soil to dry out completely inbetween waterings; regularly in the summer
feeding: Once a year with cactus food
